channel.title: [Delta]Adding a new item?
channel.description: Now I'm made my dat for my item "Rocktail" yet i get a error..can some give me the int code for adding food...heres my class8.java code of rocktail [code]if(i == 15096) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Eat"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 40806; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 2000; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.aString170 = "Rocktail"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "Some nicely cooked rocktail.".getBytes(); // Item Examine }[/code]

item.title: [Delta]Adding a new item?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:5, topic:461180”] case 15096: itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Eat"; itemDef.modelID = 4872; itemDef.modelZoom = 1460; itemDef.modelRotationY = 499; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1926; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0; itemDef.name = "Rocktail"; itemDef.description = "Tastes like shit, but good healing.".getBytes();//examine. break;

Model:

http://www.upload.ee/files/2704655/4872.rar.html[/quote]
Added your model and btw I’m not using pi, but changed my ints and got this error

Read full topic

Did you even change the model number in the models folder…?

item.title: [Delta]Adding a new item?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

			case 15096:
			itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
			itemDef.itemActions[0] = "Eat";
			itemDef.modelID = 4872;
			itemDef.modelZoom = 1460;
			itemDef.modelRotationY = 499;
			itemDef.modelRotationX = 1926;
			itemDef.modelOffset1 = 3;
			itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
			itemDef.name = "Rocktail";
			itemDef.description = "Tastes like shit, but good healing.".getBytes();//examine.
			break;

Model:

http://www.upload.ee/files/2704655/4872.rar.html

item.title: [Delta]Adding a new item?
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“promagez, post:3, topic:461180”]I already helped you with this? Change the models to something under 15000…

class8.anInt174 = 40806; //Change it to something under 15000[/quote]
My client gets a error now because it can’t load the model in the inventory heres the new int code

if(i == 15096) // Your desired item id (the one you use after ::pickup ##### #) { class8.anIntArray156 = new int[3]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Eat"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = 6027; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 2000; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up; class8.aString170 = "Rocktail"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "Some nicely cooked rocktail.".getBytes(); // Item Examine }
Btw the model is not fully 3d heres a picture of it

…The model looks normal on top but we did fill in the model since it was only going to be facing up and be placed in the inventory

Read full topic
